intro: Erodium cicutarium proles fallax, commonly known as the lesser bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Geraniaceae family. It is a low-growing annual herb with small, pink or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are opposite and heart-shaped, with a slightly serrated margin. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and along riverbanks. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution.
